gamecore.item

Interface Item

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractItem, Armor, Food, Material, Potion, Weapon

    public interface Item
    Objects implementing this interface are considered representations of physical items.

    Items should be immutable, relying on their containing Inventory and ItemDrop objects to determine changeable attributes such as stack size.

    If the item is to be usable, it should also implement either Usable or CombatUsable.
    Author:
    Alex Chythlook

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Each item has a name, which is used to determin it's identity.
      int getPotency()
      Each item has a potency, used by each implementation to determine something about the way the Item behaves.
      Rarity getRarity()
      Each item has a rarity associated with it.
      int getSaleDifficulty()
      Some items are harder to sell then others.
      int getSaleValue()
      Each item can be sold to the NPCs that buy from the player's shop.
      ItemType getType()
      Each item has a type, used to determine its class and behavior (see the ItemType enum for more information)
      int getWeight()
      The Inventory uses the weight of all it's contained items to determine how full it is.
      boolean isStackable()
      The Inventory uses this to determine if the stack size for an item can be more then 1.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Each item has a name, which is used to determin it's identity. Each name should be unique.
        Returns:
        this Item's name as a String.

      • getType

        ItemType getType()
        Each item has a type, used to determine its class and behavior (see the ItemType enum for more information)
        Returns:
        The ItemType for this item.

      • getPotency

        int getPotency()
        Each item has a potency, used by each implementation to determine something about the way the Item behaves.
        Returns:
        This Item's potency as an int.

      • getWeight

        int getWeight()
        The Inventory uses the weight of all it's contained items to determine how full it is.
        Returns:
        This Item's weight as an int.

      • isStackable

        boolean isStackable()
        The Inventory uses this to determine if the stack size for an item can be more then 1.
        Returns:
        True if the item can have a stacksize of greater then one, false if the stack size must be 1 or lower.

      • getSaleValue

        int getSaleValue()
        Each item can be sold to the NPCs that buy from the player's shop.
        Returns:
        The value of the item in gold.

      • getRarity

        Rarity getRarity()
        Each item has a rarity associated with it.
        Returns:
        The Rarity object that represents how rare this item is.

      • getSaleDifficulty

        int getSaleDifficulty()
        Some items are harder to sell then others.
        Returns:
        An int value between 1 (extremely hard to sell) and 100 (sells like hotcakes) that represents this item's chances at being sold in the player's shop.
